content: If you haven't seen the PBS videos of pitching deck landings, these are pretty cool and pretty scary (if your one of the pilots), especially pitching deck landings at night. A lot of long bolters and wave offs for sure. Parts 1 and 2 are at the link below. "http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4gGMI8d3vLs&feature=related" "The World's Finest"

content: Keg, I saw it, the pilots have nerves of steel. It ain't easy coming in on a pitching deck during daylight! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: Navy pilots have been wired up to measure stress. Night carrier landings were found to be more stressful than combat.

title: Carrier - Landing on a Pitching Deck

content: Closest thing I made to a carrier landing was from Fayetville,NC Ft Bragg to Lakehurst NJ. Got caught in between cloud layers be low me at 800 ft above about 1500. Raining. Loran said I was over the airport, caught a glimpse of it thru a small break in cloud an circled around to land into the wind. Flying by Loran only now,it said I was at end of runway an I put the airplane in a slip an burst under the cloud at 600 an slipped it in. Stood on the brakes and the tail fishtailed but I controlled it with foot pedales. Runway was only like 2800 feet FOB operator said that was the closest to a real carrier landing he ever saw. Scarey! This message has been edited. Last edited by: YankeeeSgt, Sat 30 May 2009 08:51 PM
